Class EntityForm<T extends net.tangly.core.Entity,V extends EntityView<T>>

java.lang.Object
net.tangly.ui.components.ItemForm<T,V>
net.tangly.ui.components.EntityForm<T,V>
Type Parameters:
T - type of the entity displayed in the form
V - the view owning the form
public abstract class EntityForm<T extends net.tangly.core.Entity,V extends EntityView<T>> extends ItemForm<T,V>
Create the form for a simple entity or a full entity. A simple entity has an internal object identifier, an external identifier, a human-readable name, a time interval when the entity is active, and a textual description. A full entity has additionally a set of tags and a set of comments.

Entities are immutable instances. Therefore we need to retrieve new values directuly from the form to create an update of an instance.
